This chilling horror film shares some of that same atmosphere, following two young girls who are being raised by an ancient evil in the woods. With Megan Charpentier and Isabelle Nélisse delivering standout performances as the leads, you're in for a thrilling and unsettling ride.

If you'd like to explore another option, I think "Smokin' Aces" (2006) could be up your alley. This action-comedy has a similar blend of dark humor and high-stakes action, following a group of hitmen trying to take out a snitch who's decided to cooperate with the authorities. With an all-star cast that includes Ryan Reynolds, Ben Affleck, and Jason Bateman, you're in for a wild ride!

I think I have just the right recommendations for you! Based on your interest in Hart's War, I'd like to suggest two films that explore deeper themes and feature powerful storytelling.

Firstly, I think you might appreciate Schindler's List, a historical drama that delves into the human cost of war and the importance of empathy. Directed by Steven Spielberg, this film stars Liam Neeson as Oskar Schindler, a German industrialist who saves the lives of thousands of Jews during the Holocaust.

Secondly, I'd recommend The Messenger, which also explores the psychological toll of war on its characters. This drama follows an American soldier (Ben Foster) as he navigates his feelings for the widow of a fallen officer, raising questions about loyalty, duty, and morality. Both films offer thought-provoking stories that might resonate with you.
